title: DMK unlikely to offer more seats to Secular Progressive Alliance constituents as it seeks to take in new allies
content: The DMK leadership is in no mood to concede either a share in power or an increase in the number of seats for the Congress. ‚ÄúWe will allot the same number of seats that were given to the Congress in the 2021 Assembly election,‚Äù says a senior DMK leader

content: Wildlife activist Ajay Dubey flagged a series of incidents at the Delhi Zoo, including the killing of wildlife, the illegal felling of trees, and the misuse of public funds

content: The President hails artists, sanitation workers, entrepreneurs and the Armed Forces for their contributions to the nation on the eve of the 77th Republic Day eve

title: Siddaramaiah scoffs at JD(S) coming to power in Karnataka
content: Mr. Siddaramaiah questioned how the JD(S) could realistically secure power, when it had won only 17 seats in the last Assembly elections, while the Congress had secured 136 seats ‚Äî a number that has since risen to 140.

title: Watch: Long marches | Has anything changed for tribals from 2018 to 2026?
content: The video highlights growing resistance against projects like the Vadhvan Port, which locals fear will lead to mass displacement and provide little to no benefit to the indigenous ‚ÄúBhumiputras‚Äù

title: Muslims safer in India than ever, says AIUDF chief Badruddin Ajmal
content: The All India United Democratic Front chief urged Muslims across the country to unite against the¬†Bharatiya¬†Janata Party, while accusing Congress of playing a dirty game with the minorities

title: Mamata accuses ECI of bulldozing Opposition, destroying foundation of India's democracy on ‚ÄòBJP's behalf‚Äô
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has been accusing the ECI of holding the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in West Bengal in undue haste

title: Horrific murder in Mumbai local: New CCTV footage shows moment teacher was stabbed to death
content: A college professor was fatally stabbed on a crowded Mumbai local train after a sudden argument at Malad station. CCTV footage captured the attack and helped police swiftly arrest a daily-wage labourer as the accused. The victim, Alok Kumar Singh, was a mathematics and statistics teacher.

title: President Murmu celebrates citizens‚Äô role in nation-building on Republic Day eve ‚Äì top quotes
content: President Droupadi Murmu, on the Republic Day's eve, lauded India's democratic ideals, national heroes like Netaji Bose, and citizen contributions. She highlighted women's achievements, farmer's role, tribal empowerment, economic growth, and digital India's success. The address underscored collective efforts in building a stronger, self-reliant nation, inspiring national pride and unity.

title: Padma Awards 2026: Dharmendra, Shibu Soren, Mammootty honoured - check full list
content: Veteran actor Dharmendra and former Jharkhand CM Shibu Soren will be honored with Padma Vibhushan and Padma Bhushan posthumously, respectively. India announced 131 Padma Awards for 2026, including five Padma Vibhushan, 13 Padma Bhushan, and 113 Padma Shri, recognizing distinguished service across various fields.

title: Bill Gates warns investors: Not all companies will be ...
content: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates has cautioned investors about the AI boom, warning that not all companies will thrive and some high valuations may not hold. He highlighted that AI's impact on jobs, both white-collar and blue-collar, will be felt sooner than governments anticipate, urging preparedness for economic shifts.

title: Why Microsoft is asking engineers to test Claude Code alongside GitHub Copilot
content: Microsoft is now having thousands of its software engineers test Anthropic's Claude Code alongside its own GitHub Copilot. This move signals growing confidence in AI coding tools, with even non-technical staff encouraged to experiment.  Nvidia's CEO also recently urged engineers to embrace AI coding assistants, highlighting a significant industry shift.

title: 'Local pull me out of vehicle': How seat belt saved Kerala collector's life during car crash
content: Pathanamthitta District Collector Prem Krishnan S narrowly avoided serious harm when his official car overturned after a collision with a speeding private vehicle on the wrong side of the road. The Collector, his security officer, and driver sustained minor injuries, attributing their safety to wearing seat belts.

title: 'Outright criminality': BJP leader calls for Mamata's beheading at Bengal rally; TMC hits back
content: The Trinamool Congress has strongly condemned BJP leader Sanjay Das for his derogatory remarks against West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, including calling her a "witch" and advocating for her beheading. The TMC accused the BJP of normalizing misogyny, citing Prime Minister Narendra Modi's past remarks and the act of handing a sword to another BJP leader during the event.

title: Happy Republic Day 2026: Wishes to share with friends and colleagues
content: Republic Day, celebrated annually on January 26th, commemorates India's adoption of its Constitution in 1950, marking its transition to a republic. This day honors the nation's freedom, unity, and the fundamental rights and responsibilities enshrined in its Constitution. It's a time to reflect on the values that strengthen India and encourage responsible citizenship.

title: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet urges hands-on learning; cites 300 leaders trained
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet stresses that leaders must grasp AI to guide their companies through transformation. She advocates for leader-led training, citing a client whose 300 leaders had to directly use AI tools before progress was made. This hands-on approach, starting with top executives, is crucial for unlocking AI's potential and ensuring widespread adoption across all sectors.

title: Bangladesh exit sends ripples: Pakistan says T20 WC participation uncertain
content: Pakistan's T20 World Cup squad announcement is not a confirmation of participation, with the PCB awaiting government approval. Chairman Mohsin Naqvi stated the board will follow the government's decision regarding the tournament in India and Sri Lanka. The PCB also voiced strong disapproval of the ICC's stance on Bangladesh's exclusion.

title: Watch: Hardik Pandya flies to take outrageous catch vs NZ in third T20I
content: Hardik Pandya delivered a spectacular catch in the third T20I against New Zealand. This moment of brilliance provided India with an early advantage. India captain Suryakumar Yadav won the toss and chose to bowl. Harshit Rana took an early wicket. India leads the series 2-0. The team aims to play fearlessly.

title: ‚ÄòDoesn‚Äôt pass the sniff test‚Äô: Netflix rejects Paramount‚Äôs offer for Warner Bros Discovery
content: Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters dismissed Paramount Skydance's $108 billion bid for Warner Bros. Discovery as unrealistic, citing its heavy reliance on debt. He contrasted it with Netflix's more stable $82.7 billion all-cash offer, which is gaining traction with shareholders.  The potential merger faces significant Hollywood and regulatory scrutiny.

title: India Inc cuts volume hiring: Companies go selective on STEM freshers - here's why
content: India Inc is significantly reducing fresh graduate hiring, particularly in STEM fields, as companies prioritise industry-ready talent. This shift sees a focus on smaller, skilled teams and job-ready individuals proficient in cloud platforms, data pipelines, and AI tools.

title: Rohit Sharma and Harmanpreet Kaur to receive Padma Shri
content: Rohit Sharma and Harmanpreet Kaur are set to receive the prestigious Padma Shri for their significant contributions. Sharma's leadership saw India clinch the 2024 T20 World Cup and 2025 Champions Trophy, while Kaur captained the historic Women's World Cup victory on home soil. Their achievements mark a new era for Indian cricket.

title: Taylor Swift‚Äôs Kelce Romance Sparks Fears Her Songwriting Is Slowing
content: Taylor Swift recently admitted she once feared happiness could weaken her songwriting as her romance with Travis Kelce deepened. She worried that joy might replace the emotional tension that fueled her lyrics. However, her latest album proved otherwise, showing she can create vibrant, story-driven music even during one of the happiest chapters of her life.

title: Simone Biles vs Chloe Kim: Olympic Stardom, Endorsements, and Net Worth
content: Simone Biles and Chloe Kim both became famous Olympic champions at a young age, but Biles is much richer. Biles has a net worth of approximately $25 million, compared to Kim‚Äôs $10 million. This is because Biles stays in the public eye all year, signs bigger brand deals and gets extra attention through her NFL connection after marriage. Kim‚Äôs earnings are more tied to Olympic seasons, which limits her income compared to Biles.

title: Budgets have increasingly saved taxpayers lakhs: Will you get more relief this time?
content: The choice between the old and the new income tax regime is an important one and every year, taxpayers carefully calculate the tax liability under each before deciding on which one to opt for.

title: Jason Whitlock sparks controversy with personal claim about Mike Tomlin‚Äôs exit
content: Mike Tomlin‚Äôs sudden exit from the Steelers has led to plenty of questions. The speculation grew louder after Jason Whitlock slammed how the team handled the situation, and podcast host Harold White publicly claimed Tomlin left because of personal issues. Those claims, which include rumors of a pregnancy and a payout, have not been confirmed by Tomlin or the Steelers.

title: Jin, Jiyan, Azadi! Struggles of Iranian women as protests return to streets
content: Iranian women are leading a powerful protest movement, fueled by decades of repression and a fight for basic rights. The slogan 'Woman, Life, Freedom' echoes across the nation, a testament to their courage in demanding bodily autonomy and dignity. Despite facing severe crackdowns and personal risks, their defiance, ignited by Mahsa Amini's death, continues to challenge the state's authority.

title: Mark Tully dies at 90: Born in Kolkata to British parents; how BBC journalist made India his home
content: Renowned journalist Sir Mark Tully, who spent decades reporting from India, has passed away in Delhi at 90. Born in Kolkata to British parents, Tully developed a deep connection with India, covering pivotal events like the Emergency and the assassinations of Indira and Rajiv Gandhi. His insightful books explored India's complexities, earning him prestigious awards and a lasting legacy.

title: Odia singer Abhijit Majumdar passes away: Cause of death and other details
content: The world of Odia music dimmed on January 25, 2026, with the passing of the beloved singer and composer Abhijit Majumdar at AIIMS Bhubaneswar. Enduring a series of severe health crises, including a cardiac arrest that led to refractory septic shock, his legacy is cherished by many. Read on to know more.

title: All aboard for UDAN? Regional connectivity scheme revamp awaits cabinet nod
content: India's regional air connectivity scheme is set for a major overhaul. The government plans to financially support airlines operating on remote routes to cover potential losses. This revamp aims to make flights to hinterland destinations commercially viable. The proposal awaits Cabinet approval. The scheme has already disbursed significant subsidies and invested in airport development.

title: World Cup row: Bangladesh's exit from tournament 'a sad moment for our sport'
content: The World Cricketers' Association expressed disappointment over Bangladesh's withdrawal from the T20 World Cup, calling it a "sad moment" and urging "deep reflection." The ICC replaced Bangladesh with Scotland after the BCB's request to move matches to Sri Lanka was rejected, citing security concerns. The WCA highlighted broader trends of agreements not being honored and a lack of player consultation.

title: Leon Draisaitl opens up on family and NHL absence
content: Leon Draisaitl returned to the Edmonton Oilers after a short personal leave to attend to a family illness in Germany. The star center spoke on Saturday about how the experience taught him to see hockey from a different perspective. With Draisaitl back, Edmonton looks to find consistency heading into the Olympic break.

title: Rupee sinks to 92 against US dollar: What's impacted as currency keeps sliding ‚Äî explained
content: The Indian rupee has hit a historic low against the US dollar, making imports like crude oil and electronics pricier for consumers. While this impacts overseas education and travel costs, it offers a silver lining for exporters by increasing their earnings. Experts advise a balanced approach to manage growth and inflation.

title: 'If India keep doing such circus acts': Ashwin's warning amid selection call
content: Former India all-rounder R Ashwin has urged Team India to stay patient with Sanju Samson despite his twin failures against New Zealand. With Ishan Kishan‚Äôs strong knock increasing competition and Tilak Varma set to return, Ashwin warned against frequent changes, saying it could hurt team balance. He backed Samson‚Äôs attacking intent, while Aakash Chopra called the next match crucial for his future.

title: ‚ÄòTragic farce‚Äô: Amid Bengal SIR, Mamata targets EC over national voters‚Äô day celebrations
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee fiercely criticized the Election Commission on National Voters' Day, calling it a "tragic farce" and accusing it of "destroying democracy on BJP's behalf." She alleged the EC is harassing citizens, particularly vulnerable groups, by demanding physical appearances for verification, leading to distress and deaths.

title: 'Border 2' BO collection: Sunny Deol's film shows no signs of slowing down
content: Sunny Deol's latest venture, 'Border 2', is taking the cinematic world by storm, enchanting viewers since its release during the Republic Day festivities. With an impressive box office haul topping Rs 80 crore and a remarkable Rs 30 crore on opening day alone, this war epic pays homage to its legendary predecessor while delivering a gripping tale of patriotism.

title: American dreams may have to wait! Why Indians are facing increased US visa refusals
content: Indian visa applicants face significant US processing delays, with increased 221(g) notices for background checks, including social media and old arrest records. This intensified scrutiny, particularly impacting H-1B visa holders, is causing unprecedented delays and even revocations, leaving many stranded.  Biometric requests are also up, extending evaluation times.

title: With father Lalu on stage, Tejashwi named RJD's No. 2; sister Rohini protests
content: ‚ÄãThe appointment coincided with visible signs of internal disquiet within the party. Hours ahead of the RJD‚Äôs national executive meeting in Patna on Sunday, Lalu Prasad‚Äôs daughter Rohini Acharya alleged that the party‚Äôs control had slipped into the ‚Äúhands of infiltrators and conspirators‚Äù whose sole aim, she claimed, was to destroy ‚ÄúLaluvad‚Äù.

title: NBA trade rumors: Lakers weigh move for $26M Kings power trio to upgrade roster
content: NBA trade deadline buzz sees Lakers eyeing a deal with the Kings. The proposed trade, involving Malik Monk, Keon Ellis, and Devin Carter going to LA for Dalton Knecht, Gabe Vincent, and Maxi Kleber, aims to bolster the Lakers' inconsistent bench scoring and defense. Sacramento would gain valuable assets and flexibility.

title: The new layoff era: Work is moving, not disappearing
content: Layoffs often signal a reorganisation of work rather than the end of work itself. The World Economic Forum‚Äôs Future of Jobs Report 2025 projects significant labour-market churn by 2030, with about 170 million roles created and 92 million displaced. Employers also expect major shifts in required skills, increasing the need for upskilling and redeployment as tasks change across industries and functions.

title: 'Why were India allowed?': Former Pakistan coach blasts ICC after Bangladesh World Cup exit
content: Former Australian cricketer Jason Gillespie has criticized the ICC's decision to remove Bangladesh from the 2026 Men's T20 World Cup. He questioned the lack of consistency, drawing parallels to India being allowed to play the 2025 Champions Trophy at a neutral venue due to security concerns in Pakistan. This decision has sparked wider unease within the cricketing community.

title: How India-EU trade pact will cut costs, boost trade ‚Äî explained
content: The India-EU free trade agreement is poised to boost trade and lower costs, according to GTRI. The pact leverages the distinct strengths of both economies, with India excelling in labor-intensive production and the EU in capital goods and technology. This synergy is expected to expand trade rather than harm domestic industries, benefiting producers and consumers alike.

title: After Bangladesh exit, Scotland say 'ready to play', prepare immediate India arrival
content: Cricket Scotland has accepted an invitation from the ICC to replace Bangladesh in the upcoming T20 World Cup in India. The team is preparing to travel immediately to acclimatize and compete on the global stage. This unexpected opportunity arises after Bangladesh's withdrawal due to security concerns.

title: 'I'm upset right now': Djokovic after Sabalenka breaks his Grand Slam record
content: Aryna Sabalenka reached the Australian Open quarterfinals after beating Victoria Mboko 6-1, 7-6. She dominated the match and won her 20th straight Grand Slam tiebreak, breaking Novak Djokovic‚Äôs Open Era record. Djokovic reacted jokingly, saying, "I'm upset right now." Sabalenka, a two-time Australian Open champion, continues her strong run as other top seeds also competed for quarterfinal spots.

title: ‚ÄòInjected HIV virus into doctor‚Äô: Jealous woman attacks ex-lover‚Äôs wife
content: A chilling incident in Kurnool has sparked outrage as four people, including a nurse and her young children, face serious charges after allegedly injecting a doctor with HIV-infected blood. The attack was reportedly motivated by revenge, with the victim being the ex-wife of one of the accused, who was lured into a fabricated accident as part of the sinister plot.

title: 'Evil, corrupt forces won't rule': Vijay targets DMK, AIADMK ahead of 2026 polls
content: TVK chief Vijay on Sunday said that the party has strength and resolves to defeat 'evil and corrupt' forces ahead of Tamil Nadu elections which are scheduled in 2026. During the part meeting, he also launched his party symbol 'whistle'. Vijay who launched the party in 2024 sets TVK as an alternative rival to DMK and AIADMK.

title: Sleeping Hindu man burnt to death in Bangladesh; body charred beyond recognition
content: The man was asleep inside a garage when a fire broke out. While the blaze initially appeared accidental, CCTV footage from the area has raised suspicions of possible foul play. Narsingdi Superintendent of Police Abdullah Al Faruque told ANI that investigators are examining surveillance footage that shows suspicious movement near the site.

title: Meet Simran Bala: First woman from J&K‚Äôs Rajouri to join CRPF; to lead all-male contingent on Jan 26
content: Simran Bala, a 26-year-old Assistant Commandant in the CRPF, will make history by leading an all-male contingent on Kartavya Path this Republic Day. Hailing from a border village in Rajouri, she is the first woman from her district to achieve this feat, inspiring many with her journey of hard work and dedication.

title: Nobel Laureate Roy Glauber says science is guesswork, not perfect logic
content: Roy Glauber, the physicist who won the 2005 Nobel Prize in Physics, challenged a core assumption about how science works. In interviews reflecting on his career, Glauber argued that real scientific breakthroughs rarely emerge from strict deduction. Instead, they grow out of intuition, guesswork, and sustained curiosity. His reflections offer a powerful career lesson for young scientists and educators, questioning how science is taught and how creativity truly enters research.

title: 'Vande Mataram Prayer To Bharat Mata, Instils Patriotism': President In R-Day Address
content: The historic success of Operation Sindoor was powered by India's self-reliance in the defence sector, President Droupadi Murmu said in an address to the nation today, on the eve of the 77th Republic Day celebrations.

title: Space Hero Shubhanshu Shukla Awarded Ashoka Chakra
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, who created history by becoming the first Indian to visit the International Space Station (ISS), has been honoured with the Ashoka Chakra, India's highest peacetime gallantry award.

title: Over 600,000 Lose Power As Massive Winter Storm Hits US
content: Over 600,000 customers in the United States were without power early Sunday as a massive winter storm surged from Texas to the northeast of the country, the PowerOutage.com tracking site showed.

title: Dharmendra, Adman Piyush Pandey, Cricketer Rohit Sharma Among Padma Awardees
content: Bollywood's 'He-Man' Dharmendra, former Kerala chief minister VS Achuthanandan are among the five who have been awarded Padma Vibhushan (posthumously), the country's second-highest civilian award, on the eve of Republic Day.

title: Padma Awards 2026: See Full List
content: The list of Padma Awards recipients for 2026 was announced today as the country prepares to celebrate Republic Day 2026. The awards recognised 45 unsung heroes from across the country for their distinguished service.

title: 4 Anti-Terror Ops, 13 Officers: Gallantry Awards For Delhi Police Special Cell
content: Thirteen officers of Delhi Police's Special Cell have been awarded the Police Medal for Gallantry (PMG) on the 77th Republic Day for their role in four major high-risk counter-terror operations that neutralised major threats to the national capital.

title: Man, 60, Dragged Behind Bike After Resisting Robbery
content: A 60-year-old man named Lakshman Prajapati was tied with a towel and dragged behind a vehicle, reportedly a motorcycle, for several meters by three individuals after he refused to hand over money while riding his bicycle.

title: Probe Agency ED Files Complaint Against Winzo, Alleges Rs 3,522 Crore Scam
content: The Directorate of Enforcement (ED), Bengaluru Zonal Office, filed a Prosecution Complaint on January 23, 2026, before the Special Court under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) in Bengaluru in connection with alleged money laundering.

title: Leh's Bactrian Camels Galwan And Nubra To Walk Down Delhi's Kartavya Path
content: In a historic first for the Republic Day Parade, two majestic doublehumped Bactrian camels, named Galwan and Nubra, will walk down Kartavya Path.

title: 75-Year-Old's 300 Km Rickshaw Odyssey To Get Wife Treated
content: In a remarkable display of devotion reminiscent of Bihar's "Mountain Man" Dashrath Manjhi, a 75-year-old man from Odisha recently travelled 300 kilometers by rickshaw to ensure his paralysed wife received life-saving medical treatment.

title: "Paying With Health": Rahul Gandhi Urges Action Against Air Pollution
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said that people are paying a heavy price for air pollution with their health and the country's economy, and that children and the elderly are bearing the brunt the most.

title: 'Bengal Wants This Change?' BJP Leader's Mamata Banerjee Remark Sparks Row
content: As the political temperature in West Bengal rises ahead of the Assembly polls, the ruling Trinamool Congress has slammed the main opposition BJP over a video of a BJP leader's crass remarks for Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee

title: "Productive But Complex": S Jaishankar, US Lawmakers Discuss Ties
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Sunday discussed with a three-member American Congressional delegation various aspects of India-US relations, including trade and security, against the backdrop of continuing strain in ties.

title: Modi Government's Budgets: Journey Of Development, Welfare And Reforms
content: The government led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi has, in just over a decade, transformed the country's budget from a mere document of revenue and expenditure into a powerful instrument for shaping India's economic direction.

title: A Tribal District Faced Non-Veg Ban On Republic Day. Why It Didn't Work Out
content: Odisha's Koraput district came into the political limelight in recent days after a massive row erupted over a planned ban on non-vegetarian food on the occasion of 77th Republic Day.

title: 90-Year-Old Musician, Mumbai Paediatrician On Padma Awards' 'Unsung Heroes' List: Sources
content: This year‚Äôs Padma list continues the focus on celebrating ‚Äúordinary Indians with extraordinary contributions.‚Äù

title: US Immigrants Ghosted Anti-Immigration Officers. Why It May Not Work Now
content: Since coming to the United States 30 years ago from Mexico, Fernando Perez said US immigration officers have stopped by his home numerous times, but he has never once answered the door.

title: Journalist And Author Mark Tully Dies At 90
content: Veteran journalist Mark Tully, a chronicler of India and an acclaimed author, breathed his last at a private hospital here on Sunday, his close friend said. Tully was 90.

title: New NASA Study Explains How Earth Got Its Water
content: A NASA study shows that meteorites delivered only a small amount of water to Earth over the past four billion years.
